inlineContent.text: It looks a bit different than other GTK dialogs such as the
, since some platforms donâ€™t expose enough
infrastructure to implement a good print dialog. On such
platforms,
uses the native print dialog.
On platforms which do not provide a native print dialog, GTK
uses its own, see [class
The typical way to use the high-level printing API is to create
a
object with [ctor
when the user selects to print. Then you set some properties on it,
e.g. the page size, any [class
] from previous print
operations, the number of pages, the current page, etc.
Then you start the print operation by calling [method
It will then show a dialog, let the user select a printer and options.
When the user finished the dialog, various signals will be emitted on
the
, the main one being
[signal[PrintOperation](//documentation/gtk/printoperation/ondrawpage(flags:handler:)], which you are supposed to handle
and render the page on the provided [class
] using Cairo.
By default
uses an external application to do
print preview. To implement a custom print preview, an application
must connect to the preview signal. The functions
[method
[method
] and
[method
are useful when implementing a print preview.
The
protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying
instance.
The default implementation of these can be found in the protocol extension below.
For a concrete class that implements these methods and properties, see
Alternatively, use
as a lighweight,
reference if you already have an instance you just want to use.
